title: Traffic Signal Groundman
description:
Location:

Sunnyvale, US, 75182

Type of Employment: Full-time

Career Level: Professional

Job Family:

Date posted: Apr 2, 2024

Committed to the safe and reliable transportation of people throughout all modes of transportation, Yunex Traffic develops software and hardware solutions to enhance road safety, improve traffic flows and help cities to effectively handle their transportation infrastructure. While Yunex is a well-established player in the traffic controller, traffic management and traffic service market, we are a true innovation leader when it comes to implementing connected vehicle technology – being the backbone of safe self-driving vehicles. Many signature customers across the US like Miami, Seattle, New York City or Tampa believe in us. While Yunex prides itself of being a high pace, fast growing business we still lead to maintain our family-style working atmosphere

Yunex is seeking a Traffic Signal Groundman to join our team in Dallas, Texas.

The successful candidate will assist with installation and maintenance of cables, fibers, and cameras associated with traffic signal and street light systems. You will work closely with engineering technicians to provide optimum installation and maintenance services to agency customers. The crew will occasionally work overtime and working outside is to be expected. If you have a background with electrical work or road construction, we'd love to have you apply & join our team!

Requirements

Minimum 1-2 years experience as a ground laborer, handling materials and hand tools.Prior work experience in traffic, road work a huge plus.May be required to get IMSA Work Zone Safety certification and bucket truck operator certification.Must be able to lift and move equipment weighing up to 40 lbs.Must be able to pass a DOT (Department of Transportation) physical exam and drug test, have a valid driver's license, and insuranceMust be able to work as part of a teamMust be able and willing to work at heights typically associated with installation, repair, and maintenance of traffic signals and streetlightsAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentMust adhere to environmental, health and safety regulations, work procedures and guidelinesMust have basic hand tools, other specialized tools will be provided by the company.

Responsibilities

Maintains street level plant and equipment daily including concrete ground boxes, poles, and various containers housing traffic signal switching and other electrical equipment.Utilizes hand tools, shovels, and concrete equipment when maintaining, removing, or installing new underground conduit and related equipment.Operates hydraulic bucket truck when needed.Performs maintenance on traffic lighting fixtures, cameras and other housings when needed, utilizing hand and power tools.Mixes & pours concrete on new installationsProvides periodic on-call services.

Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

Yunex Traffic believes that working collaboratively in the office allows for in-person group thinking and building on teamwork. Work schedules are determined jointly between the employee and their supervisor.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Yunex Traffic is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local la

Nearest Secondary Market: Fort Worth

title: Account Manager - Commercial P&C Construction Insurance
description:
Alliant Insurance Services is one of the nation’s largest and fastest-growing insurance brokerage and consulting firms. We operate through a network of specialized national platforms and local offices to offer our clients a comprehensive portfolio of solutions built on innovative thinking and personal service. Alliant is changing the way our clients approach risk management and benefits, so they can capitalize on new opportunities to grow and protect their organizations.

More information is available on the company's website at: www.alliant.com .

Summary

Responsible for providing customer service and overall service of assigned customers and/or policies, soliciting of new business on existing accounts and support of Producer-led new business efforts.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

 Supports Producer in developing new business opportunities for existing clients and prospects;

Initiates renewal process for existing clients, and discusses and creates renewal strategy with

Producer;

 Analyzes and compares current exposures and develops renewal or new business

specifications for marketing;

 Conducts marketing, negotiates rates, reviews quotes and coverages for competitiveness and

accuracy;

 Reviews and summarizes marketing results and prepares proposals; Finalizes proposals and presentations in coordination with Producer; Binds insurance coverage and prepares binders and/or delegate certificates issuance; Reviews policies for accuracy and review contracts; Prepares summaries and/or schedules of coverage for clients; Reviews client accounting history, responds to accounting inquiries, corrects discrepancies,

and contacts client on receivable collections;

 Participates in the claims process as directed by management, including claim submission,

follow-up and overall communication;

 Provides technical guidance to staff assisting with client needs or procedural issues; Notifies brokers of pertinent information related to client retention; Meets with clients as needed or directed by Producer; Collection of fees, reconciliation and resolution of any outstanding balances within 90 days of

invoicing date;

 Complies with agency management system data standards and data integrity (enters and

maintains complete and accurate information);

 Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

Associates degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Six (6) or more years related work experience;

Valid insurance license

Must continue to meet Continuing Education requirements for license renewal

Encouraged to complete Career Path requirements as communicated by supervisor

Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Ability to work within a team and to foster teamwork

Excellent customer service skills, including telephone and listening skills

Good leadership, problem solving and time management skills

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite

We are proud to provide comprehensive, high quality employee programs to meet employees’ needs now and in the future, including a very competitive financial package. We encourage you to explore what we have to offer.

For immediate consideration for this position, please click on the “Apply Now" button.

Alliant Insurance Services, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

If you are applying for a job and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please call our Career Center at 1-877-901-9473 and let us know the nature of your request and contact information.

For more information on Alliant Insurance Service's benefits, visit the link below.

https://www.alliant.com/media/p33ldzpp/recruitment_benefits_2022-23.pdf

title: Carpenter I
description:
Primary Purpose Of Position

Responsible for the construction and repair of wood and wallboard fixtures in compliance with local building codes and general construction principals.

EXPECTATIONS OF ALL TEAM MEMBERS

At Mortenson, we believe everyone is a leader. For that reason, every team member is expected to apply our leadership principles – Do the Right Thing, We Before Me and Inspire What’s Possible – in their work. This means we act with dependability, initiative and a positive attitude to produce high quality work and deliver an exceptional customer experience. We are on time, productive and consistent in our attendance. We approach work as part of a team, listen to the opinions of others and cooperate to achieve project goals. We accept direction from supervisors and seek out constructive feedback. We follow rules and procedures to ensure quality work and safeguard the wellbeing of ourselves and others. We push to exceed the established goals, standards and accountabilities of our positions to increase quality, safety and innovation.

All team members are responsible for supporting a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment, as well as positively contributing to our company culture. This begins by aligning with Mortenson’s values and ethical standards as stated in the Mortenson Code of Ethics and Business Conduct, in addition to abiding by the procedures and practices outlined in the Mortenson Operations Manual.

______________________________________________________________________________________

Key Result Areas (essential Functions)

Set up trailers

Study blueprints, sketches or building plans for information pertaining to type of material required, such as lumber or fiberboard. Measures the dimensions of structure of fixture to be fabricated

Build decks, stairs, roofs and other temporary structures between office units, plan tables, install shelves, setup tool trailers and/or conex’s, silt fences and/or straw bales, setup site per erosion control plan

Hand-set forms and/or assemble the gang forms

Assist journeyman and foreman with the shooting of grades and elevations

Unload, handle, stockpile, and erect of all pre-fabricated materials

Concrete and rough carpentry

Hand set WallsFootingsSet Gang Wall FormsStructural Concrete DecksDrywallFinish Carpentry, doors, frames, and hardwareMillwork and cabinetry

Effectively work and build relationships with those of diverse backgrounds and organizational levels

title: Workday Adaptive Planning Senior Principal Consultant
description:
Cognizant has partnered with Workday to deploy Adaptive Insights, a modern cloud-based business planning and analytics solution. The ideal candidate will have financial/multi-dimensional modelling experience and possess the ability to quickly understand and decompose financial, business, and technical concepts.

Key Areas Of Responsibility

Work with clients to understand their current planning process and take a consultative approach to move legacy models into Adaptive Insights.Leverage your expertise to recommend the best solution based on the client’s requirements, budget, and time frame; with the flexibility to adapt the scope as additional needs are identified.Guide the customer through facilitated design sessions and configuration decisions based on best practices and an understanding of the customer’s unique business requirements at all stages of the project.Regularly engage and support the client through all phases of the project, ensuring a smooth transfer from legacy systems to Adaptive Insights.Perform multiple tasks under limited direction, while regularly keeping the client, your project team and your Engagement Manager abreast of changes or progress related to the project.Act as a mentor to fellow consultants and analysts, including providing support for shadow assignments.Assist with sales activities by attending sales calls as an Adaptive Insights subject matter expert.Work with Solutions Architects to review Statements of Work (SOWs) to assure proper scoping, timelines, and resource allocations.Actively participate in update training and internal opportunities to share one’s skills and learnings with others within the organization.Maintain cutting-edge knowledge of product functionality with each new Workday release.

Skills And Qualifications

BA or equivalent in Finance or Accounting.4+ years of experience working on medium to large scale Adaptive Insights implementations (preferred), or other EPM systems such as Anaplan, SAP, Sage Intacct, Host Analytics, or Vena.5+ years of Finance/Consulting work experience with a background in accounting, finance, consolidation, management reporting, planning and analysis, forecasting and budgeting.Proven ability of leading teams of consultants in delivering complex technology solutions.Proven track-record of client success with an ability to plan, monitor and report project plans with experience managing budget, scope and timelines. Ability to speak to both the financial and technical aspects of EPM. Experience managing technical upgrades and ETL/data movement is a plus.Ability to create and sustain a relationship with clients, inspiring confidence in themselves and the delivery team while driving to reference-ability.Deep knowledge of EPM software industry market and products.Minimal travel required, but must be willing to travel on-site if needed

Why Choose Cognizant

Entrepreneurial environment that welcomes your ideasOpportunity to do great workOutreach programs that support communities and tap into your volunteer spiritLearning opportunities to help current needs and advancementGlobal operations, with opportunities in North America, Europe and Asia PacificAn abundance of Affinity groups to meet your needs

Cognizant Core Values

Start with a point of view: I apply my expertise to gain trust and to lead our clients forward.Seek data, build knowledge: I use facts to guide my actions and decisions.Always strive, never settle: I act with agility and creativity, determined to stay one step ahead.Work as one: I deliver solutions that draw upon the full power and scale of Cognizant.Create conditions for everyone to thrive: I include, enable, and invest in everyone around me.Do the right thing, the right way: I always make the ethical choice.

title: Food Service Worker
description:

Category:  Food Service

CMC Support, 99 Highway 37 West, Toms River, NJ 08755

Job Overview

The Food Service Worker performs a wide variety of routine tasks in the kitchen, tray line and dishwashing areas according to standard practices and procedures while complying with regulatory requirements, ensuring that customer needs and satisfaction are met.

Required:

Preferred

Previous food service experience preferred

Serves on tray assembly line in assigned position involving duties such as starter, server, soups, dessert, hot beveragesWashes pots and pans and performs heavy cleaning duties as directedAssist in care and maintenance of work areas equipment and suppliesClean and sanitize work area and equipmentCollects, processes and disposes of trash, cans, bottles, and recyclables to disposal area properlyCorrectly labels and dates all portioned food productsDelivers & pick up trays to patient according to department policyMaintain established policies and procedures, standards, and practices in food preparation to achieve department objectives in high quality, nutritional mealsPerforms general routine cleaning duties and non-round duties as directedPrepares, loads and transports food trucksProperly strip trucks, scrapes plates and pre-soaks silverwareInforms nursing personnel when a patient needs assistance or has a question food service worker cannot answerListens to patient and communicates patients concerns to Diet Office

title: Website Marketing Specialist
description:
Location: Alpharetta, GA Workstyle: Hybrid (40% Remote) 

What Makes a Honda, Is Who Makes a Honda

Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one.We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals.

At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success.We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.”

We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.

If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!

About This Position

The role is responsible for overseeing the production, development, and maintenance of the Honda Powersports brand website and organic social media channels. These pieces provide the vast majority of customer facing information for the MC, ATV, and SXS business.

Responsibilities Include

 Plan and manage existing Powersports digital properties (brand site, microsites) including strategy, content updates, and model releases. Define and development of website enhancements for performance optimization and review and approve staging updates. Oversee the development and execution of all paid and organic social media campaigns created by advertising agency partners. Provide reporting metrics on Powersports digital properties for new model tracking. Collaboration on cross department and enterprise-wide website and digital initiatives. Budget development and utilization tracking/analysis.

Who We Are Seeking

 Required Work Experience: 

 5 years of experience in digital marketing, website management, or similar field, power sports experience a plus Communications, UX (User Experience), Marketing and other industry education a plus

Required Education

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration/Marketing/Advertising

Desired Skills

 Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint proficiency required SAP familiarity desired Strong communication skills Project management experience Detail oriented Comfortable doing presentations to upper management

Additional Position Factors

 Workstyle:Hybrid (40% Remote) Travel:10%

At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo.We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities.We are Honda!

 What differentiates Honda and makes us an employer of choice? 

Total Rewards

 Competitive Base Salary Annual Bonus Overtime Industry leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Rx) Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days 401K Plan with company match additional contribution Relocation assistance

Career Growth

 Advancement opportunities Career mobility Education reimbursement for continued learning Training and Development programs

Additional Offerings

 Wellbeing program Community service and engagement programs Product programs Free drinks onsite

Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

title: Grader Sorter I
description:
Overview

The Grader/Sorter I position is responsible for the accurately and concisely receiving of both natural and lab grown stones from outside manufacturers, as well as customer trades and outside sales.

The pay range for this role is $21-25 per hour.

Responsibilities

 Comply and ensure accuracy on all material testing procedures assigned.  Maintain excellent records immediately notifying supervisors of any documentation or SAP discrepancies during all steps of processing.  Ensure accuracy within areas of responsibility before distributing to other areas. Work with supervisor to resolve any issues.  Data entry both in SAP and Microsoft office applications.  Assist in the physical inventory count and reconciliation research when requested.  Keep supervisor informed as to what is happening within areas of your responsibility.  Additional duties as assigned.  May also be responsible for: Test stones to protect inventory integrity.  Sort, validate and or grade loose stones according to company standards.  Package and label merchandise for sale following established rules.  Using equipment to capture data and or images for use in the selling process.  Sieving and or gauging stones to separate by sizes.  Balance back vendor paperwork to system reports before sending to accounting.  Cross train between team groups of Serialized, Components, and Service Orders 
Qualifications

 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.  Possess excellent manual dexterity with small items.  Demonstrated ability to see and discern very minor details both to the naked eye and with the aid of magnification.  Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy.  Intermediate skills with Outlook, Excel and Word preferred, but not mandatory.  Demonstrated ability with math. Adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing  Understanding and ability to work with decimal numbers, fractions, and percentages.  Ability to convert fractions, decimals, and percentages.  Experience with SAP preferred, but not mandatory. 
 Behavioral Characteristics 

Focused; can concentrate on the task at hand for sustained periods. Consistently and patiently thorough. Works at a consistent pace in an environment that can sometimes be very fast paced. Comfortable with familiar processes and environments. Follows well-established plans. Attentive to, careful and accurate with the details involved in a job. Detail-oriented. A reliable team member who enjoys work of a high quality. Works autonomously in their area of expertise.

 Work Environment 

The primary environment for this role is an open workspace which is brightly lit, subdued with regard to bright color and decoration, and relatively free of clutter. Considerable business is conducted using the telephone and computer technology. Work requires dexterity with small objects, visual acuity, and ability to discern color gradations. Travel may be required to stores, conferences or events up to 5% of the time.

 Why Work for Shane Co.? 

Benefits

Joining #TeamShaneCo comes with a host of benefits designed to support you and your loved ones- we understand a supportive benefits package is key to a fulfilling work experience. As a family-owned business, we prioritize your well-being, recognizing that our success is a collective effort. Here's what we offer:

Compensation and Recognition: we operate on a team-based model; no commission sales! We offer a competitive base rate, engaging SPIFs, and monthly opportunities for team performance bonuses.

Time off: You’ll enjoy a generous time-off package, including 3 weeks of vacation, and an annual float day. We value holidays and are closed on major ones. Plus, you receive a float day and paid volunteer day annually. We also value your work-life balance and keep favorable hours that provide a great retail experience to our customers while respecting your time and well-being.

Family-centric benefits: We care about your family, and our benefits extend beyond standard offerings. In times of major illness, you can earn time off at full pay for self or family care. You’ll also benefit from paid parental leave, an Employee Assistance Program, and assistance navigating medical complexities.

Health and wellness: We value your health and provide you with paid sick time. Additionally, you can access competitive medical, dental, and vision plans, a 401(k) with company match, and flexible spending accounts. You can also enjoy voluntary benefits, including long-term disability, life insurance for dependents, and pet insurance. We also have a dedicated staff member who focuses on well-being and work-life balance, ensuring you thrive professionally and personally.

Employee Discount: Enjoy a generous store and online discount, available for you and your family members.

Shane Co. serves our customers with an unparalleled standard of excellence. Our people get to share in our customers’ milestone moments such as weddings, birthdays, anniversaries, and everything in between.

Our goal for you is to give you an employment experience like no other so you wake up and want to come to work every day! If you love being part of a team as well as providing personal attention to every customer, this is the place for you!

The pay range for this role is $21-25 per hour. The range describes the minimum to maximum likely rate for this job description in the state of Colorado. Individual pay will be determined based on skills and qualifications for the role. The salary range for this same position may be lower or higher in markets outside of Colorado.

Employer will not sponsor visa or work authorization.

title: Enterprise Applications Developer
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, TEKsystems c/o Allegis Group, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Seeking an Application Engineer whose primary focus will be ensuring the stability, availability, and supportability of the Enterprise application stack. This person will work closely with the Enterprise Applications Manager, Accounting, Marketing, Records, and other firm personnel to ensure all applications run optimally and without interruption. Good communication, technical and analytical skills are required, with a heavy focus on Windows Server and SQL (querying, reporting in SSIS and other tools, maintenance, documentation, and upgrades). Some programming knowledge would be a 'nice to have,' but expert knowledge is not required.

Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities:

Administer, develop, and support the platform. Including, but not limited to Thompson Reuters Elite 3E, Paperless Performa, Design Gallery ("DG"), Workspace, and Iridium.Responsibilities within the firm's financial/marketing application stack include:Scheduling month-end maintenance such as: Windows updates, SQL maintenance, query optimization, and security patchingInter-department coordination during system upgrades; assessing and communicating risk factors of upcoming upgrades, primarily when integrated systems cause a "trickle-down" effectCoordinate with application stakeholders and IT team to prioritize and address issues and future objectives for financial systemsResponsible for testing financial system applications during system changes, enhancements, upgrades, and monthly system maintenance,Documentation of system setup, integrations, backup, and disaster recovery processesCommunicates and informs the department and management of project statuses, issues, and proposed resolutionsManage vendor support ticketsTrack and optimize system performance and storage utilization, plan for necessary hardware or software upgrades to support system growthResearch and evaluate new tools/technologies to improve the current application stackUtilize tools to protect application source code and maintain versioning.Any additional responsibilities as required by managementOther responsibilities include:Compulaw administration, maintenance and integrationsBasic 'end user' application troubleshooting and maintenance such as: FasTax, B&A Forms, Allstate legal forms, LexisNexis etc.Support requests/tickets escalated from the helpdesk teamDocumentation of processes/procedures, 'how-to' guides, and frequently asked question resolution

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

3+ years' experience operating with legal accounting and time management software required, experience with Elite 3E preferredFluency in the Elite 3E SQL database schema preferred or demonstrated ability to develop such fluencyExperience with maintaining 3E Templates ("Design Gallery"), Workspace and BizTalkProficiency in Elite Application Framework and Tools; Example: IDEKnowledge of 3E Solutions Manager a plusProficiency in SQL reporting ("SSRS")Ability to learn functional and technical integration aspects of the firm's applications such as Iridium, Foundations, ConcurExperience administering Windows ServerSolid technical foundation with the ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve complex problems and implement solutions with minimal guidanceSelf-motivated person with excellent time management skillsStrong analytical skills with the ability to communicate resultsExcellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to communicate with staff of varying technical expertiseProficiency in XML/XSLT transformationKnowledge of C# and Visual Basic .Net, HTML5 programming

Non-essential Functions:

Responsible for communication, coordination, and "backup" of other members of the Information Technology Department as required to service the firm and its clientsExempt position: expected to work additional hours, weekends, and holidays, as required in the performance of duties.This position is considered essential to the function of the firm. Therefore, attendance during firm administrative leave and closings may be required.Support and monitor firm policies and procedures as pertains to the Information Technology Department

Qualifications:

To succeed in this position, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:

Minimum 3 years experience in management, design, and implementation of large enterprise applications in a heterogeneous operating system environment with hands-on experience in maintaining mission-critical enterprise applications at a high level of availability.Requires broad knowledge of the specialized and technical field of computer science and business/management acumen equivalent to a complete college or university education; includes thorough skills knowledge.4-year college degree preferred; equivalent experience considered.

Technical Skills & Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years' experience in the design, implementation and maintenance of Windows computer systems. Experience with Microsoft SQL required, working knowledge of Active Directory administration and maintenance a plus. Experience with Thomson Reuters 3E and Foundations Experience management system administration required. iManage document management system administration is a plus. Proven experience supporting a large number of end users, 300+.

title: CNC Operator 2nd Shift
description:
Job Number: 59131

Group: Magna Powertrain

Division: MPT Sterling Heights

Job Type: Permanent/Regular

Location: STERLING HEIGHTS

Group Introduction

Advancing mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, and safer, while still fun to drive. And making it for everyone. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain. We do it by creating world-class powertrain solutions for conventional, hybrid, and pure electric vehicles. We’re making electrification more than a buzzword, we’re bringing it to the road. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.

Role Summary

To manufacture quality parts as directed within an acceptable time frame to assist the organization in meeting all MAFACT and customer’s requirements and to perform the assigned task in a safe manner. All aspects & functions involved in the CNC Operators role of producing quality parts in a MAFACT team process while meeting all regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities

 Operate CNC machine independently with minimal supervision. Must make minor offset adjustments and/or tool changes to maintain part conformance to print. Troubleshoot on the CNC horizontal and vertical mill, lathe and perform setups and tool changes as required. Monitor tool life. Check parts and place them on the equipment or gauging stations correctly. Able to operate on line gauging and understand the readings. Meet production requirements in a timely/efficient manner. Fill out production sheets and all other production related documents as required and monitor SPC/quality and document updates. Perform related labor as required to clean up, set up, and organize. Assist the material handler as required. Give direction to Production Operators assigned to job. Demonstrate Common Values. Support the Environmental Management System and objectives. Complete and maintain all required paperwork such as white boards, quality checks, production reporting forms, MAFACT, die set up sheets, checklists etc. Work with Engineering and MAFACT teams to develop and implement standardized work for all processes on their respective line(s). Perform audits to ensure standardized work is adhered to. Initiate corrective measures for non-standardized work and daily maintenance of team board. Responsible to ensure that all safety and quality start-up procedures are followed. Responsible to produce quality parts according to customer specifications. Review and follow standardized work instructions. Responsible to perform all required quality checks utilizing gages and other measuring devices as required in the control plan. Make adjustments, as necessary, Ensure that process tags are properly completed throughout the production run. Ensure all containers are properly labeled. Report any injuries, accidents, equipment malfunctions, property damage etc. to Supervisor. Responsible to manage the cleanliness and orderliness of the work area (5S).



Key Qualifications/Requirements

High School diploma or G.E.D. 2-3 years CNC Operating experience. Ability to use gauges, change tools, make offsets/changes, and program changeovers is required. Advanced knowledge of machining fundamentals i.e. turning, milling is required. Must have good shop math skills. Results-oriented team player, excellent attendance, high energy level and good attention to detail. Demonstrates creativity, initiative, and problem solving skills. Ability to work overtime or alternate shifts as required.

Additional Information

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Chemist III
description:
Job#: 2023510

Job Description:

Apex Systems is seeking a Chemist III in support of the City of Baltimore!

For immediate consideration please send an updated copy of your resume to Megan at [email protected] with “Chemist III Baltimore, MD” in the subject line** Title: Chemist III Compensation: $36-$38/hr Location: Baltimore, MD 21202 Duration: 3-6Contract to Hire Summary: The qualified individual will be responsible for Receiving dictation of letters and reports and transcribing material into desired typed format; proofreads typed copy; corrects spelling, grammar, and punctuation. Producing typed copy from written communication and types of similar materials as above from rough written copy; proofreads typed copy; corrects spelling, grammar, and punctuation. Maintaining a filing system by taking file folders, categorizing materials according to established system, and searching files for materials needed. Responsibilities:  Performs basic to complex wet chemistry, organics, and metals analysis on samples from the raw water reservoirs, drinking water distribution system and water filtration plant, for both routine tests and special studies, according to approved Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and the laboratory’s quality management system, as directed by the Laboratory Technical Supervisor.  Complex analyses require using specialized equipment such as Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometer, Gas Chromatography and Mass Spectroscopy and/or Ion Coupled Plasma Mass Spectroscopy.  May also assist with microbiology analyses. This function includes sample handling and maintenance of chain-of-custody.  Records test results per the SOPs and quality management system. Enters and maintains test result data and quality control data in the laboratory information system (LIMS) to produce reports for the Laboratory Technical Supervisor’s review.  Is responsible for batching or ensuring that daily work orders are available in LIMs.  Completes Individual Demonstration of Competency, proficiency testing, method detection limit procedures and other quality management system tests, as directed by the Laboratory Technical Supervisor.  Reports any non-conformance, per the quality management system, and participates in corrective action investigations, as directed by the Laboratory Technical Supervisor.  Reviews work of subordinate chemists.  Trains subordinate chemists and microbiologist in the routine analysis of drinking water and subordinate chemist in the routine use of analytical instruments including its calibration, maintenance, safety protocols and record keeping.  Completes training logs for each analyst and reports findings to superiors.  Complete equipment calibration according to the quality management system and manufacturer’s direction.  Record all calibration and equipment quality assurance measurements, per the test SOP and quality management system.  Notify the Laboratory Technical Supervisor immediately if any equipment deficiencies are encountered.  Leads developments of Standard Operating Procedures for the work unit, as directed by the Laboratory Technical Supervisor or Section Chief.  Allows shadowing by other DPW staff of lab activities for the purposes of education and evaluation.  Maintains work area in a clean and safe manner, according the Laboratory Chemical Hygiene Plan.  Restocks material and inventory as needed.  Performs related work as required, including performing public relations tours, educational liaison or special projects as directed by the Laboratory Supervisor.  Assist in the daily activities of chemical and microbiological analyses of raw and treated water for both laboratories in the event of an emergency and/or severe staffing shortages. 

 Qualifications: 

 Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry  Great Mathematical skills  Experience with GC, GC Mass Spec, Discrete Analyzer, and ICP-MS/OES experience.  Experience with EPA methods – 200.7,200.8,525,533 For immediate consideration please send an updated copy of your resume to Megan at [email protected] with “Chemist III Baltimore, MD” in the subject line**

title: Jr. Weld Engineer
description:
Job Number: 66145

Group: Cosma

Division: Magna Structures Tennessee

Job Type: Jr. Weld Engineer

Location: Lawrenceburg, Tennessee

About Us

We see a future where everyone can live and move without limitations. That’s why we are developing technologies, systems and concepts that make vehicles safer and cleaner, while serving our communities, the planet and, above all, people.

Forward. For all.

Group Summary

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

About The Role

PURPOSE OF POSITION:

Weld Engineers are responsible for management and support of all plant weld systems and documentation, and for working with Engineering on new weld machine controls and standards. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability, and essential duties required to successfully perform this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is a salaried position, primarily on first shift.

Your Responsibilities

RESPONSIBILITY AND AUTHORITY:

Adhere to and comply with and exceed where possible all applicable federal, state, and OSHA environmental, health and safety laws, regulations, external & internal standards, and other requirements in all its operations which relate to its health, safety, and environmental aspects.

Familiarity with Engineering and Quality practices and procedures including APQP, PPAP, blueprint reading, GD&T, use of measuring instruments, checking aids / fixtures, computer applications, mechanical testing, and customer and IATF 16949 requirements.

Good organizational, leadership, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills

Ensure Team Members use or wear the protective equipment required by Magna Structures Tennessee LLC.

Members of any potential hazards and/or provide written instructions as to the measures to protect the Team Member

Take every precaution reasonable in the circumstances for the protection of a Team Member and report any known contravention out of their control to their BU Leader/Manager

Conduct accident / incident investigations and implement corrective actions and Continued Improvements

Conduct monthly safety inspections and implement corrective actions.

Correct unsafe acts or conditions.

Correct or commends health & safety performance.

Who We Are Looking For

KNOWLEDGE:

Proficiency with Advanced Product Quality Planning methods

Strong Computer Skills Are Required.

Knowledge in OSHA safety requirements

Strong experience / knowledge in robotic programming for welding processes, preferably using Fanuc or MotoMan equipment.

EDUCATION:

4 Year Weld Engineering Degree or equivalent

WORK EXPERIENCE:

Minimum 3 - 5 years’ experience in an automotive welding engineering, design, and program development environment

Resistance Welding Experience Required.

Prior experience in weld laboratory duties

Your Preferred Qualifications

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITIONS:

Provide technical welding expertise to the weld lab, including personnel, equipment, documents, and records of compliance. Evaluate and make recommendations regarding current and new weld assembly processing, tooling, and equipment.

Provide Engineering and Quality Assurance personnel as assigned with welding expertise to support existing and new customer programs.

Develop and implement training and certification program for production associates in robotic and hand GMAW/TIG welding techniques and procedures.

Develop and implement work instructions for part fit-up, tack, weld, and repair requirements.

Develop and implement parameters for weld length, leg length, throat length, penetration, and structural quality for welded automotive assemblies.

Develop and implement a training program for maintenance technicians in the troubleshooting and repair of robotic GMAW welding equipment.

Develop and implement a training program for troubleshooting and problem solving of welding issues.

Participate in APQP processes relating to the design of weld assembly work cells and tooling.

Recommend design changes to improve quality, reliability, and productivity of welding processes.

Develop and implement documents and procedures for validation of welding equipment and processes to meet or exceed customer specifications.

Supervise and manage the setup and programming of robots for welding.

Promote continual improvement in weld quality and weld processes.

Maintain weld drawings.

Achieve department objectives in support of company production, quality, and safety goals.

Work effectively with Q.A., Engineering and Production departments’ associates for continual improvement of department methods, procedures, and policies; assist in the implementation of.

Communicate effectively with company personnel, customers, and vendors.

Attend and participate in department meetings, plant meetings, and training; participate in customer visitations as designated by the department manager.

Support new program launches and customer expectations.

Provide reports as required by the Engineering Manager or other departments.

Participate in Continual Improvement activities.

Adhere to customer requirements, Business Operating System, and company policies.

Perform other duties as assigned.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Able to use computer and software as required.

Able to travel.

Able to demonstrate understanding of how job performance affects product quality and customer satisfaction.

Able to work well with others; build and maintain positive employee relations.

Able to prepare, read, write, and interpret written reports, procedures, instructions, and guidelines.

Able to effectively present information and respond to questions from management, employees, suppliers and customers and work effectively within a team environment.

Able to organize, schedule, and manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

Able to use computer and software as required.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The work environment is a combination of office and manufacturing plant, with an emphasis on manufacturing plant. The individual must be able to perform all essential functions as appropriate on the plant floor, in meetings, and with employees, management, customers and suppliers.

Flexible hours are required.

Requires travel to customer and tooling facilities as needed.

Able To Work Flexible And Additional Hours As Required.

Able to travel.

EQUIPMENT / TOOLS USED:

Some of the equipment and tools used are computer, telephone, fax machine, copier/printer, and a projector.

What We Offer

Competitive Salary, Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription, Paid Vacation/Holidays, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, 401K Match.

Site Benefits

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

title: Outside Plant Line Maintenance & Construction II
description:
Overview

As an Outside Plant Line Maintenance and Construction II in Blue Ridge, GA you will perform general labor associated with outside plant line maintenance. Operates construction equipment which includes, but is not limited to, trenchers, backhoes, end loaders and plows in order to place cable facilities. Installs, tests,maintains, troubleshoots, and repairs aerial and underground cable facilities within TDS Telecom serving areas. Work is performed in accordance with state and local regulations in a safe manner.

The pay range listed for this position represents the low and high end of the base compensation range. The actual offer amount will carefully consider multiple factors, such as relevant skills, qualifications, work experience, location and/or competencies that align with the specified role. Certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation such as bonuses and equity awards.

This position can be hired at either a Outside Plant Line Maintenance and Construction I (requisition 2024-23374), or an Outside Plant Line Maintenance and Construction II (requisition 2024-23375) level, depending on the skills and qualifications of the candidate. Different job postings exist for each of these positions. Please reference each job posting for the minimum qualifications required for each role and submit an application for each level that you are both interested and qualified for.

TDS Telecommunications LLC (TDS Telecom/TDS®) delivers high-speed internet, TV entertainment, and phone services to a mix of small to mid-sized urban, suburban, and rural communities throughout the U.S. With 1.2 million connections, TDS is a rapidly growing technology company. Powered by fiber optics and new industry-leading technologies, TDS delivers up to 8 Gigabit internet speeds and offers internet-protocol-based TV entertainment solutions along with traditional phone services. TDS also offers businesses VoIP advanced communications solutions, dedicated internet service, data networking, and hosted-managed services. Visit tdstelecom.com .

TDS Telecom, headquartered in Madison, Wis., employs 3,600 people and is a subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems, Inc. [NYSE: TDS], a Fortune 1000® company. Founded in 1969, Telephone and Data Systems provides wireless, broadband, video and voice; and hosted and managed services to approximately 6 million connections nationwide through its businesses: UScellular, TDS Telecom, and OneNeck IT Solutions. Visit tdsinc.com .

Responsibilities

 Performs general line maintenance in various weather conditions while utilizing safety fundamentals. Completes fallen tree removals from aerial plant, including right of way tree trimming as needed.  Completes DSA structure support repairs (wooden, metal decking).  Replaces broken, sets new, and realigns poles as needed – includes reattaching all cables.  Performs pole transfers per designated work order requests.  Performs all necessary line repairs – strand, lashing wire, guy wires, anchor placing, proper slack placement, etc.  Operates construction and other excavating equipment to construct,maintain, and repair outside plant cable facilities.  Performs the maintenance, repairs, and placement of new (copper, fiber, coax) aerial and buried cable according to maps, staking sheets and locate markings.  Reviews and updates GIS, maps, addresses, as-builds.  Sets peds, vaults, and handholes along with marking/labeling fiber optic, copper/coax facilities.  Installs, troubleshoots, tests, splices, repairs, and maintains fiber optic/copper/coax facilities.  Identifies location of defective cable using various test equipment and repairs buried, aerial, underground and/or customer cable.  Locates cable and fiber in response to customer requests and/or construction needs.  Performs cable fault acceptance tests on newly constructed facilities.  Ensures worksite and landscape is fully restored after project completion.  Proficiently operates all test equipment associated with outside plant facilities.  Perform other duties as assigned.  Trains and monitors personnel as directed by supervisor or team lead.  Services, cleans, maintains, and repairs equipment.  Completes all related electronic work order and or / paperwork in a timely manner. 
The functions listed above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities; other duties may be assigned.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications

 1+ years of construction experience utilizing construction equipment such as a trencher, plow, and backhoe -OR- current military service, or prior military service with honorable discharge.  1+ years of telecommunications outside plant experience.  Must follow the TDS attendance guidelines to meet TDS’s business needs including but not limited to our obligations to our customers and to our customers' needs.  Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and remain eligible for DOT requirements. 

Other Qualifications

 Understanding of telecommunication products and services.  Must have the ability to obtain a Class A CDL. A current CDL is preferred at hire, but TDS will train and certify eligible associates through its in-house CDL certification program after hire.  Upon hire, must successfully complete customer-specific requirements, which may include a background check administered by the customer.  Proven organizational skills and ability to multi-task.  Physical requirements may vary based on company needs: Ability to dig, lift and climb.  Requires being available for on-call/standby responsibilities and may require occasional travel.  Must be willing to work overtime as needed. May be required to work various/swing shifts as business needs dictate.  Must be able to operate vehicles with manual transmissions. 

Do you meet all of the Required Qualifications, but aren't sure if your experience meets the Other Qualifications? We encourage you to apply! Research shows that some candidates may not apply for jobs unless they feel they meet 100% of the qualifications, when, in fact, they have the skills and experience to be successful in the role! Experience and skills come in many different forms and may not always look identical to what we have on paper, but still lead to success in the role. If you meet the Required Qualifications and believe you have what it takes to be successful in the position, apply today!

Physical Demands and Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The associate must also be able to climb poles, ladders, towers or other structures. The associate is occasionally required to sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, and taste or smell. The associate must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions and may have to work in attics and crawl spaces, or high-risk areas such as high voltage electrical, trenches, and manholes. The associate is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts and heavy equipment; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; and vibration. The associate is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and extreme heat. The noise level in the work environment is at times loud.

Benefits

Associates scheduled to work 20 or more hours per week have access to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off benefits such as vacation (15 days accrued per year for full-time; pro-rated for part-time associates working between 20-39 hours), sick leave (10 days accrued per year for full-time and pro-rated for all other associates), seven paid national holidays and one floating holiday, paid parental leave (2 weeks after 12 months of employment), among others. Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability coverage is also available for associates working 30 or more hours per week and Education Assistance is available to full-time associates. Associates scheduled to work under twenty hours per week or for a limited term (i.e. interns) are eligible for medical coverage, the 401(k) plan (if 18 or older), as well as sick leave (10 days accrued per year for full-time and pro-rated for all other associates). For more detail on the benefits we offer click here .

At TDS, we embrace Equal Employment Opportunity by valuing our differences and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by law. To learn about our diversity & inclusion philosophy and culture, click here!

 Pay Range (Hr./Yr.) 

$24.63/Hr. - $36.95/Hr.

Must follow the TDS attendance guidelines to meet TDS’s business needs including but not limited to our obligations to our customers and to our customers' needs.  Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and remain eligible for DOT requirements. 

Other Qualifications

 Basic understanding of telecommunication products and services.  Must have the ability to obtain a Class A CDL. A current CDL is preferred at hire, but TDS will train and certify eligible associates through its in-house CDL certification program after hire.  Upon hire, must successfully complete customer-specific requirements, which may include a background check administered by the customer.  Proven organizational skills and ability to multi-task.  Physical requirements may vary based on company needs: Ability to dig, lift and climb.  Requires being available for on-call/standby responsibilities and may require occasional travel.  Must be willing to work overtime as needed. May be required to work various/swing shifts as business needs dictate.  Must be able to operate vehicles with manual transmissions. 

Do you meet all of the Required Qualifications, but aren't sure if your experience meets the Other Qualifications? We encourage you to apply! Research shows that some candidates may not apply for jobs unless they feel they meet 100% of the qualifications, when, in fact, they have the skills and experience to be successful in the role! Experience and skills come in many different forms and may not always look identical to what we have on paper, but still lead to success in the role. If you meet the Required Qualifications and believe you have what it takes to be successful in the position, apply today!

Physical Demands and Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The associate must also be able to climb poles, ladders, towers or other structures. The associate is occasionally required to sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, and taste or smell. The associate must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions and may have to work in attics and crawl spaces, or high-risk areas such as high voltage electrical, trenches, and manholes. The associate is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts and heavy equipment; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; and vibration. The associate is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and extreme heat. The noise level in the work environment is at times loud.

Benefits

Associates scheduled to work 20 or more hours per week have access to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, a 401(k) plan, and paid time off benefits such as vacation (15 days accrued per year for full-time; pro-rated for part-time associates working between 20-39 hours), sick leave (10 days accrued per year for full-time and pro-rated for all other associates), seven paid national holidays and one floating holiday, paid parental leave (2 weeks after 12 months of employment), among others. Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability coverage is also available for associates working 30 or more hours per week and Education Assistance is available to full-time associates. Associates scheduled to work under twenty hours per week or for a limited term (i.e. interns) are eligible for medical coverage, the 401(k) plan (if 18 or older), as well as sick leave (10 days accrued per year for full-time and pro-rated for all other associates). For more detail on the benefits we offer click here .

To learn about our diversity & inclusion philosophy and culture, click here!

title: Federal Project Manager
description:
Job#: 2025595

Job Description:

Project Managers are seller-doers who develop and maintain client relationships. They will have the responsibility for coordinating and leading our design teams to deliver quality projects that make our clients successful. The ideal candidate for this position will have experience working on DOE, facility, laboratory, and federal campus infrastructure projects. Additional science and technology and/or federal agency experience including federally funded research and development centers (FFRDCs), GSA, and DOS a plus. They will manage construction administration activities and have experience with design-build projects. title: Supply Chain Associate Manager – Staffing COE
description:
Overview

Location Free Role - Prefer candidate that resides in the southwest region.

This person will support the Manufacturing Plants, Warehouses, and Service Operations (SOPS) locations in the Southwest Region with staffing needs to become “Staffed, Stable and Capable”. The role will serve as a direct link to the field regarding headcount and staffing which will include headcount tracking, analysis, and retention improvements. The position will fall underneath the Staffing Center of Excellence team.

Responsibilities

Provide hiring and retention tactics to meet staffing Employer of Choice (EOC), turnover, OT and FTU targets for assigned locations in the Southwest region.Work with field contacts to develop the desired End-To-End Employee Experience focusing on our COE workstreams of “Staffed, Stable, Capable”.Primary point of contact for assigned Region’s MFG, WH & SOPS locations to escalate staffing needs or emergency staffing coverage.Consistent communications for field support, including site visits to support Staffing Points and partnering with Region Performance Managers and FL-Select HR team to reach Staffing KPIs/goals.Support Regional and Site Staffing venues. (i.e. Deep Dives, Site Staffing meetings, Vertical Team calls/meetings)Help the sites optimize work schedules be leveraging the Predictive Staffing Model.Support the implementation of WAVE conversations and the deployment of No Forced Overtime for assigned locations in the Southwest region.Communicate updates / answer questions and ensure EOC changes are updated on One Stop Shop for designated region.Manage staffing algorithm process to help the field effectively determine staffing headcount requirements.Facilitate / Collaborate National Staffing Calls with Staffing Points, HRBP’s and Senior Leadership.Manage third-party labor (3PL) relationships to support field staffing gaps and expedite staffing efforts (Pontoon, A1QLS, Launch).Support field headcount tracking to include reporting, insights, and analysis.Support the field locations in minimizing Temporary EE utilization for assigned locations.Participate on staffing cadence.% Travel: 20%-30%

Compensation And Benefits

The expected compensation range for this position is between $85,200 - $142,650 based on a full-time schedule.Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary.Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annually.Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement.In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s DegreeIn depth knowledge of manufacturing operationsProven collaborative, leadership, and influencing capabilities.Practical knowledge of Office suite of toolsStrong organizational and analytical abilitySelf-starter with attention to detail; Ability to identify business issues and generate solutions.Ability to interact with diverse organizations at all levels, including Senior ExecutivesSolid verbal and written communication and presentation skillsAbility to manage multiple competing priorities.Strong change management and project management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Operations Management or BusinessField operations leadership with 3+ years’ experienceStrong project management skillsIn depth knowledge of field staffing processes and tools

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Overview

Job Locations:

For this HYBRID role, candidate must live 90 miles from one of the following locations: Plano, TX, Dallas, TX, Purchase NY, New York, NY -- This role is HYBRID, NOT 100% remote

We are PepsiCo

PepsiCo is one of the world's leading food and beverage companies with more than $79 Billion in Net Revenue and a global portfolio of diverse and beloved brands. We have a complementary food and beverage portfolio that includes 22 brands that each generate more than $1 Billion in annual retail sales. PepsiCo's products are sold in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo's strength is its people. We are over 250,000 game changers, mountain movers and history makers, located around the world, and united by a shared set of values and goals.

We believe that acting ethically and responsibly is not only the right thing to do, but also the right thing to do for our business. At PepsiCo, we aim to deliver top-tier financial performance over the long term by integrating sustainability into our business strategy, leaving a positive imprint on society and the environment. We call this Winning with Purpose. For more information on PepsiCo and the opportunities it holds, visit www.pepsico.com.

Digital Products and Services at PepsiCo

The Digital Evolution is critical to driving PepsiCo’s ambitions around being FASTER, STRONGER, and BETTER. The Digital Products & Services team designs, builds, and stands up digital solutions across the value chain, that are embedded into business processes to optimize efficiency, reduce costs, and maintain high ROI. Guided by PEPSICO’s global priorities, the Digital Products & Services team create user-centric digital products that can be scaled globally by leveraging the leading technologies, advanced analytics algorithms and latest user research.

Software Engineering, Associate Manager

The Software Engineering Associate Manager will be an individual contributor and play a pivotal role in software development activities and long-term initiative planning and collaboration across the Strategy & Transformation (S&T) organization. Software Engineering is the cornerstone of scalable digital transformation across PepsiCo’s value chain. This leader will deliver the end-to-end software development experience, deliver high quality software as part of the DevOps process, and have accountability for our business operations.

The leader in this role will provide technical oversight and direction to our software development team to ensure we deliver the best possible software solutions and ensure they are generating value through cost savings or incremental value. This leader will work closely with the user experience, product, IT, and process engineering teams to develop new products and prioritize deliver solutions across S&T core priorities.

Responsibilities

Role Responsibilities:

Support the vision and guide a team of engineers to build and support digital products and services (DPS) across S&T core prioritiesDrive partnerships with User Experience, Product Management, IT, Data & Analytics, Emerging Tech, Innovation, and Process Engineering teams to deliver the Digital Products portfolioDevelop software development strategy utilizing industry standards. Create roadmap and timing of implementation of the roadmap based on business requirements and strategy.Lead multi-discipline, high-performance work teams distributed across remote locations effectively. Build, manage, develop, and mentor a team of engineers.Interact with executives across the company to lead the narrative around software engineeringDevelop and expand DPS capabilities through a customer obsessed, services-driven digital solutions platform that leverages data and AI to deliver automated and personalized experiencesManage and appropriately escalate delivery impediments, risks, issues, and changes tied to the engineering initiatives to the stakeholdersInteract with key business partners to recommend solutions that best meet the strategic needs of the business

Compensation and Benefits:

The expected compensation range for this position is between $115,000 - $197,500 based on a full-time schedule.Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary.Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annually.Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement.In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferred degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related fieldMaster’s or PhD in Computer Science or Engineering preferredMinimum of 6 years of relevant software development and engineering management experience3+ years of experience on architecting fault tolerant, high scale distributed systems Commanding knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design are a must have. Full stack engineering experience: ReactJS/React Native Front-End frameworks + Java (with focus on Back End – candidate will ideally be 60% Back end, 40% Front end)Experience with Azure (preferred), Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services and cloud specific PaaS and SaaS solutions Experience with mission critical, 24x7 systems Experience with high throughput cloud native distributed systems Experience implementing and consuming large-scale web services Deep knowledge of design patterns 

Qualities

Strong attention to detail and extremely well-organizedAbility to run a large team of software engineersAbility to manage multiple projects with competing prioritiesAbility to be able to interface with the business and recognize their needs and prioritiesAbility to work cross functionally with product, service design and operations across the organizationDemonstrated passion for excellence with respect to Engineering services, education, and supportStrong interpersonal skills, ability to navigate through a complex and matrixed internal environmentAbility to work collaboratively with regional and global partners in other functional units

EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
